key_points: Tiger Woods is in good spirits but hasn't been able to play any golf following his car crash in February.
He has not visited his South Florida restaurant, The Woods Jupiter, since before the accident.
Rickie Fowler commented on Woods' intense rehab process, noting it's a long road ahead for him.
On February 23, Woods experienced a single-vehicle rollover crash in Southern California, resulting in significant orthopedic injuries.
Woods underwent surgery for "comminuted open fractures" to his lower right extremity, including his tibia and fibula.
Documents reveal Woods had no recollection of driving or how the accident occurred.
Los Angeles County Sheriff stated speed was the primary cause of the crash, with no signs of impairment found.
In his first interview post-accident, Woods expressed his goal of walking on his own again and noted the unprecedented pain from his injuries.
Woods thanked people for their support since the crash, highlighting the importance of the support he received.
Woods declined to answer whether he would be able to play golf again in his Golf Digest interview.
spokespersons: Anish Mahajan, MD (Chief Medical Officer, Harbor-UCLA Medical Center)
